description: Describes a detector model. If the version parameter is not specified, information about the latest version is returned.

parameters.name: detectorModelName
parameters.description: The name of the detector model.

nested_items.name: detectorModel
nested_items.description: Information about the detector model.

nested_items.name: detectorModelDefinition
nested_items.description: Information that defines how a detector operates.

nested_items.name: states
nested_items.description: Information about the states of the detector.

nested_items.name: stateName
nested_items.description: The name of the state.

nested_items.name: events
nested_items.description: Specifies the actions performed when the condition evaluates to TRUE.

nested_items.name: eventName
nested_items.description: The name of the event.

nested_items.name: condition
nested_items.description: Optional. The Boolean expression that, when TRUE, causes the actions to be performed. If not present, the actions are performed (=TRUE). If the expression result is not a Boolean value, the actions are not performed (=FALSE).

nested_items.name: actions
nested_items.description: The actions to be performed.

nested_items.name: setVariable
nested_items.description: Sets a variable to a specified value.

nested_items.name: variableName
nested_items.description: The name of the variable.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The new value of the variable.

nested_items.name: targetArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Amazon SNS target where the message is sent.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: iotTopicPublish
nested_items.description: Publishes an MQTT message with the given topic to the AWS IoT message broker.

nested_items.name: mqttTopic
nested_items.description: The MQTT topic of the message. You can use a string expression that includes variables ( $variable.<variable-name>) and input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>) as the topic string.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: timerName
nested_items.description: The name of the timer.

nested_items.name: seconds
nested_items.description: The number of seconds until the timer expires. The minimum value is 60 seconds to ensure accuracy. The maximum value is 31622400 seconds.

nested_items.name: durationExpression
nested_items.description: The duration of the timer, in seconds. You can use a string expression that includes numbers, variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), and input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>) as the duration. The range of the duration is 1-31622400 seconds. To ensure accuracy, the minimum duration is 60 seconds. The evaluated result of the duration is rounded down to the nearest whole number.

nested_items.name: clearTimer
nested_items.description: Information needed to clear the timer.

nested_items.name: timerName
nested_items.description: The name of the timer to clear.

nested_items.name: resetTimer
nested_items.description: Information needed to reset the timer.

nested_items.name: timerName
nested_items.description: The name of the timer to reset.

nested_items.name: functionArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Lambda function that is executed.

The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: iotEvents
nested_items.description: Sends AWS IoT Events input, which passes information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action.

nested_items.name: inputName
nested_items.description: The name of the AWS IoT Events input where the data is sent.

nested_items.name: contentExpression

The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: queueUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the SQS queue where the data is written.

nested_items.name: useBase64
nested_items.description: Set this to TRUE if you want the data to be base-64 encoded before it is written to the queue. Otherwise, set this to FALSE.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: deliveryStreamName
nested_items.description: The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream where the data is written.

nested_items.name: separator
nested_items.description: A character separator that is used to separate records written to the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream. Valid values are: --n' (newline), --t' (tab), --rn' (Windows newline), --,' (comma).

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: hashKeyType
nested_items.description: The data type for the hash key (also called the partition key). You can specify the following values:
'STRING' - The hash key is a string.
'NUMBER' - The hash key is a number.

nested_items.name: hashKeyField
nested_items.description: The name of the hash key (also called the partition key). The hashKeyField value must match the partition key of the target DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: hashKeyValue
nested_items.description: The value of the hash key (also called the partition key).

nested_items.name: rangeKeyType
nested_items.description: The data type for the range key (also called the sort key), You can specify the following values:
'STRING' - The range key is a string.
'NUMBER' - The range key is number.

nested_items.name: rangeKeyField
nested_items.description: The name of the range key (also called the sort key). The rangeKeyField value must match the sort key of the target DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: rangeKeyValue
nested_items.description: The value of the range key (also called the sort key).

nested_items.name: operation
nested_items.description: The type of operation to perform. You can specify the following values:
'INSERT' - Insert data as a new item into the DynamoDB table. This item uses the specified hash key as a partition key. If you specified a range key, the item uses the range key as a sort key.

'UPDATE' - Update an existing item of the DynamoDB table with new data. This item's partition key must match the specified hash key. If you specified a range key, the range key must match the item's sort key.
'DELETE' - Delete an existing item of the DynamoDB table. This item's partition key must match the specified hash key. If you specified a range key, the range key must match the item's sort key.

nested_items.name: payloadField
nested_items.description: The name of the DynamoDB column that receives the action payload.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the DynamoDB table. The tableName value must match the table name of the target DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: dynamoDBv2
nested_items.description: Writes to the DynamoDB table that you created. The default action payload contains all attribute-value pairs that have the information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action. You can customize the payload. A separate column of the DynamoDB table receives one attribute-value pair in the payload that you specify. For more information, see Actions in AWS IoT Events Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: iotSiteWise
nested_items.description: Sends information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action to an asset property in AWS IoT SiteWise .

nested_items.name: entryId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for this entry. You can use the entry ID to track which data entry causes an error in case of failure. The default is a new unique identifier.

nested_items.name: assetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the asset that has the specified property.

nested_items.name: propertyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the asset property.

nested_items.name: propertyAlias
nested_items.description: The alias of the asset property.

nested_items.name: propertyValue
nested_items.description: The value to send to the asset property. This value contains timestamp, quality, and value (TQV) information.

nested_items.name: stringValue
nested_items.description: The asset property value is a string. You must use an expression, and the evaluated result should be a string.

nested_items.name: integerValue
nested_items.description: The asset property value is an integer. You must use an expression, and the evaluated result should be an integer.

nested_items.name: doubleValue
nested_items.description: The asset property value is a double. You must use an expression, and the evaluated result should be a double.

nested_items.name: booleanValue
nested_items.description: The asset property value is a Boolean value that must be 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'. You must use an expression, and the evaluated result should be a Boolean value.

nested_items.name: timestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp associated with the asset property value. The default is the current event time.

nested_items.name: timeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The timestamp, in seconds, in the Unix epoch format. The valid range is between 1-31556889864403199.

nested_items.name: offsetInNanos
nested_items.description: The nanosecond offset converted from timeInSeconds. The valid range is between 0-999999999.

nested_items.name: quality
nested_items.description: The quality of the asset property value. The value must be 'GOOD', 'BAD', or 'UNCERTAIN'.

nested_items.name: transitionEvents
nested_items.description: Specifies the actions performed, and the next state entered, when a condition evaluates to TRUE.

nested_items.name: eventName
nested_items.description: The name of the transition event.

nested_items.name: condition
nested_items.description: Required. A Boolean expression that when TRUE causes the actions to be performed and the nextState to be entered.

nested_items.name: actions
nested_items.description: The actions to be performed.

nested_items.description: Sets a variable to a specified value.

nested_items.description: The name of the variable.

nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: hashKeyType
nested_items.description: The data type for the hash key (also called the partition key). You can specify the following values:
'STRING' - The hash key is a string.
'NUMBER' - The hash key is a number.

nested_items.name: hashKeyField
nested_items.description: The name of the hash key (also called the partition key). The hashKeyField value must match the partition key of the target DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: hashKeyValue
nested_items.description: The value of the hash key (also called the partition key).

nested_items.name: rangeKeyType
nested_items.description: The data type for the range key (also called the sort key), You can specify the following values:
'STRING' - The range key is a string.
'NUMBER' - The range key is number.

nested_items.name: rangeKeyField
nested_items.description: The name of the range key (also called the sort key). The rangeKeyField value must match the sort key of the target DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: rangeKeyValue
nested_items.description: The value of the range key (also called the sort key).

nested_items.name: operation
nested_items.description: The type of operation to perform. You can specify the following values:
'INSERT' - Insert data as a new item into the DynamoDB table. This item uses the specified hash key as a partition key. If you specified a range key, the item uses the range key as a sort key.

'UPDATE' - Update an existing item of the DynamoDB table with new data. This item's partition key must match the specified hash key. If you specified a range key, the range key must match the item's sort key.
'DELETE' - Delete an existing item of the DynamoDB table. This item's partition key must match the specified hash key. If you specified a range key, the range key must match the item's sort key.

nested_items.name: payloadField
nested_items.description: The name of the DynamoDB column that receives the action payload.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the DynamoDB table. The tableName value must match the table name of the target DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: dynamoDBv2
nested_items.description: Writes to the DynamoDB table that you created. The default action payload contains all attribute-value pairs that have the information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action. You can customize the payload. A separate column of the DynamoDB table receives one attribute-value pair in the payload that you specify. For more information, see Actions in AWS IoT Events Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the DynamoDB table.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: iotSiteWise
nested_items.description: Sends information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action to an asset property in AWS IoT SiteWise .

nested_items.name: entryId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for this entry. You can use the entry ID to track which data entry causes an error in case of failure. The default is a new unique identifier.

nested_items.name: assetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the asset that has the specified property.

nested_items.name: propertyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the asset property.

nested_items.name: propertyAlias
nested_items.description: The alias of the asset property.

nested_items.name: propertyValue
nested_items.description: The value to send to the asset property. This value contains timestamp, quality, and value (TQV) information.

nested_items.name: stringValue
nested_items.description: The asset property value is a string. You must use an expression, and the evaluated result should be a string.

nested_items.name: integerValue
nested_items.description: The asset property value is an integer. You must use an expression, and the evaluated result should be an integer.

nested_items.name: doubleValue
nested_items.description: The asset property value is a double. You must use an expression, and the evaluated result should be a double.

nested_items.name: booleanValue
nested_items.description: The asset property value is a Boolean value that must be 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'. You must use an expression, and the evaluated result should be a Boolean value.

nested_items.name: timestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp associated with the asset property value. The default is the current event time.

nested_items.name: timeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The timestamp, in seconds, in the Unix epoch format. The valid range is between 1-31556889864403199.

nested_items.name: offsetInNanos
nested_items.description: The nanosecond offset converted from timeInSeconds. The valid range is between 0-999999999.

nested_items.name: quality
nested_items.description: The quality of the asset property value. The value must be 'GOOD', 'BAD', or 'UNCERTAIN'.

nested_items.name: events
nested_items.description: Specifies the actions that are performed when the state is exited and the condition is TRUE.

nested_items.name: eventName
nested_items.description: The name of the event.

nested_items.name: condition
nested_items.description: Optional. The Boolean expression that, when TRUE, causes the actions to be performed. If not present, the actions are performed (=TRUE). If the expression result is not a Boolean value, the actions are not performed (=FALSE).

nested_items.name: actions
nested_items.description: The actions to be performed.

nested_items.name: setVariable
nested_items.description: Sets a variable to a specified value.

nested_items.name: variableName
nested_items.description: The name of the variable.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The new value of the variable.

nested_items.name: targetArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Amazon SNS target where the message is sent.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: iotTopicPublish
nested_items.description: Publishes an MQTT message with the given topic to the AWS IoT message broker.

nested_items.name: mqttTopic
nested_items.description: The MQTT topic of the message. You can use a string expression that includes variables ( $variable.<variable-name>) and input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>) as the topic string.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: timerName
nested_items.description: The name of the timer.

nested_items.name: seconds
nested_items.description: The number of seconds until the timer expires. The minimum value is 60 seconds to ensure accuracy. The maximum value is 31622400 seconds.

nested_items.name: durationExpression
nested_items.description: The duration of the timer, in seconds. You can use a string expression that includes numbers, variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), and input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>) as the duration. The range of the duration is 1-31622400 seconds. To ensure accuracy, the minimum duration is 60 seconds. The evaluated result of the duration is rounded down to the nearest whole number.

nested_items.name: clearTimer
nested_items.description: Information needed to clear the timer.

nested_items.name: timerName
nested_items.description: The name of the timer to clear.

nested_items.name: resetTimer
nested_items.description: Information needed to reset the timer.

nested_items.name: timerName
nested_items.description: The name of the timer to reset.

nested_items.name: functionArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Lambda function that is executed.

nested_items.name: contentExpression
nested_items.description: The content of the payload. You can use a string expression that includes quoted strings ( '<string>'), variables ( $variable.<variable-name>), input values ( $input.<input-name>.<path-to-datum>), string concatenations, and quoted strings that contain ${} as the content. The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: iotEvents
nested_items.description: Sends AWS IoT Events input, which passes information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action.

nested_items.name: inputName
nested_items.description: The name of the AWS IoT Events input where the data is sent.

nested_items.name: contentExpression

The recommended maximum size of a content expression is 1 KB.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The value of the payload type can be either STRING or JSON.

nested_items.name: queueUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the SQS queue where the data is written.

nested_items.name: useBase64
nested_items.description: Set this to TRUE if you want the data to be base-64 encoded before it is written to the queue. Otherwise, set this to FALSE.

nested_items.name: contentExpression

nested_items.description: Sends information about the detector model instance and the event that triggered the action to an asset property in AWS IoT SiteWise .

nested_items.name: entryId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for this entry. You can use the entry ID to track which data entry causes an error in case of failure. The default is a new unique identifier.

nested_items.name: assetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the asset that has the specified property.

nested_items.name: propertyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the asset property.

nested_items.name: propertyAlias
nested_items.description: The alias of the asset property.

nested_items.name: propertyValue
nested_items.description: The value to send to the asset property. This value contains timestamp, quality, and value (TQV) information.

nested_items.name: stringValue
nested_items.description: The asset property value is a string. You must use an expression, and the evaluated result should be a string.

nested_items.name: integerValue
nested_items.description: The asset property value is an integer. You must use an expression, and the evaluated result should be an integer.

nested_items.name: doubleValue
nested_items.description: The asset property value is a double. You must use an expression, and the evaluated result should be a double.

nested_items.name: booleanValue
nested_items.description: The asset property value is a Boolean value that must be 'TRUE' or 'FALSE'. You must use an expression, and the evaluated result should be a Boolean value.

nested_items.name: timestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp associated with the asset property value. The default is the current event time.

nested_items.name: timeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The timestamp, in seconds, in the Unix epoch format. The valid range is between 1-31556889864403199.

nested_items.name: offsetInNanos
nested_items.description: The nanosecond offset converted from timeInSeconds. The valid range is between 0-999999999.

nested_items.name: quality
nested_items.description: The quality of the asset property value. The value must be 'GOOD', 'BAD', or 'UNCERTAIN'.

nested_items.name: initialStateName
nested_items.description: The state that is entered at the creation of each detector (instance).

nested_items.name: detectorModelConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about how the detector is configured.

nested_items.name: detectorModelName
nested_items.description: The name of the detector model.

nested_items.name: detectorModelVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the detector model.

nested_items.name: detectorModelDescription
nested_items.description: A brief description of the detector model.

nested_items.name: detectorModelArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the detector model.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that grants permission to AWS IoT Events to perform its operations.

nested_items.name: creationTime
nested_items.description: The time the detector model was created.

nested_items.name: lastUpdateTime
nested_items.description: The time the detector model was last updated.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the detector model.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The value used to identify a detector instance. When a device or system sends input, a new detector instance with a unique key value is created. AWS IoT Events can continue to route input to its corresponding detector instance based on this identifying information.

nested_items.name: evaluationMethod
nested_items.description: Information about the order in which events are evaluated and how actions are executed.
